Specification Statement Description: The Name Server must be capable of managing two types of data; zones and cached data.
The Name Server must cache recent query results to improve the performance of the Name Server.
The Name Server must discard any old cached data after a its TTL has expired. The default TTL is 86400 seconds.
If the Name Server is able to resolve a Domain Name from information in its database, then the Name Server must return the location of that resource.
If the Name Server is unable to resolve the Domain Name locally, then the name of another Name Server must be returned.
The Name Server shall be refreshed by reading data from a Zone File and updating the data in the Name Server Database.
The Format of the data loaded into the Name Server Database shall be validated before the data is loaded into the Name Server.
If the Zone File does not satisfy the specifcation items S.ZoneFileFormat1-4, then no changes will be made to the Name Server Database.
The Name Server database shall only be modified, once all the Zone File data has been loaded and validated.
The Name Server must be capable of understanding Domain Names that are supplied in the DNS Protocol Format (RFC 1035).
The input parser should seek to error correct obvious errors in the input format.
The Name Server shall process requests asynchronously.
The zone file shall be re-read if its contents change.
Errors in the zone file shall be recorded in the system log.
